full.title: Case Report: Premature Ventricular Beats-Induced Chronic Cough and Cough Syncope.
full.authorString: Hu Y, Hua W, Li N, Huang H.

authorAffiliation.affiliation: Key Laboratory of Respiratory Disease of Zhejiang Province, Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine, Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine, Hangzhou, China.

full.abstractText: Background: Chronic cough is a common complaint that in rare cases can be caused by premature ventricular beats (PVCs). Materials and Methods: In this report, we present the case of a healthy 44-year-old female who presented persistent cough and cough syncope that was attributed to PVCs. Results: The cough disappeared after radiofrequency ablation, and no recurrence of arrhythmia or cough was observed. Conclusion: PVCs should be considered a probable cause of chronic cough and cough syncope in differential diagnosis.
full.affiliation: Key Laboratory of Respiratory Disease of Zhejiang Province, Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine, Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine, Hangzhou, China.

Conclusion: PVCs should be considered a probable cause of chronic cough and cough syncope in differential diagnosis.
title: Case Report: Premature Ventricular Beats-Induced Chronic Cough and Cough Syncope.
